text: The Mono Lake Tufa State Reserve is a nature reserve near Yosemite National Park within Mono County, California. This reserve was founded in 1981 by the California State Legislature, to protect the formations of the natural limestone "Tufa" at Mono Lake.California State Parks Official site The park is located on the south shore of Mono Lake and is located 15 miles east of Yosemite National Park and 2 miles north of Lee Vining Village. ==References== Category:State parks in the United States Category:Geography of California
title: Mono Lake Tufa State Reserve
